questions.question_text: Why did Abbu Khan’s goats want to run away? What happened to them in the hills?
hints: Think about the goats' natural instincts
Consider what Abbu Khan provided vs. what they desired

questions.question_text: Abbu Khan said, “No more goats in my house ever again.” Then he changed his mind. Why?
hints: Consider Abbu Khan's emotional state
Think about his lifestyle without goats

questions.question_text: Why did he buy a young goat?
hints: Consider his past experiences with goats
Think about his expectations from a young goat

questions.question_text: Why did Chandni hate the rope round her neck?
hints: Consider what the rope symbolizes
Think about Chandni's desires and observations

questions.question_text: “Now Abbu Khan understood Chandni’s problem...” What was Chandni’s problem?
hints: Look at what Chandni explicitly tells Abbu Khan
Consider her physical and emotional state

questions.question_text: Abbu Khan pushed Chandni into a small hut. This shows that he (i) was cruel. (ii) loved her and wanted to save her life. (iii) was selfish.
hints: Consider Abbu Khan's previous actions and warnings
Analyze his motivation behind this action

questions.question_text: Why did Chandni refuse to join the group of wild goats?
hints: Consider what Chandni valued most at that moment
Think about her reason for coming to the hills

questions.question_text: Chandni fought the wolf because she (i) was stronger than the wolf. (ii) hated the wolf. (iii) had to retain her freedom at all costs.
hints: Recall Chandni's conversation with Abbu Khan before leaving
Consider what she values most

questions.question_text: Why did the wise old bird say, “Chandni is the winner”?
hints: Consider different definitions of 'winning'
Think about what Chandni achieved versus what she lost

questions.question_text: “Death in an open field is better than life in a small hut,” Chandni said to herself. Was it the right decision? Give reasons for your answer.
hints: Consider both perspectives: safety vs. freedom
Think about the story's message

questions.question_text: Freedom is life. Discuss this with reference to ‘Chandni’ and ‘I Want Something in a Cage’.
hints: Compare the themes of both stories
Consider how different characters view freedom
